str2: And, even, also, namely.
Simeon or Simon. From the same as Simon; Symeon, the name of five Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (lit: I speak well of) I bless; pass: I am blessed. From a compound of eu and logos; to speak well of, i.e. to bless.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A mother. Apparently a primary word; a 'mother'.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To lie, recline, be placed, be laid, set, specially appointed, destined. Middle voice of a primary verb; to lie outstretched.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A rising again, resurrection. From anistemi; a standing up again, i.e. a resurrection from death (its author), or a recovery.
And, even, also, namely.
A falling, a fall, ruin. From the alternate of pipto; a crash, i.e. Downfall.
Much, many; often.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Israel, the adopted name of Jacob, including his descendants.
And, even, also, namely.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of semaino; an indication, especially ceremonially or supernaturally.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To speak or say in opposition, contradict (oppose, resist). From anti and lego; to dispute, refuse.
